item.title: 64 Bit Operating System
item.description: A step-by-step explanation of working of my 64-Bit Operating System. Tools Used: VS Code Qemu Docker Languages used: Assembly Language C Language Step 1: Docker Image: We make a docker file and import a premade docker image that contains all the packages we need. We also need nasm to compile our assembly code and grub. Following is the code for that: FROM randomdude/gcc-cross-x86_64-elf // Premade image on the docker website // Run these terminal commands in our linux virtual machine RUN apt-get update RUN apt-get upgrade -y RUN apt-get install -y nasm RUN apt-get install -y xorriso RUN apt-get install -y grub-pc-bin RUN apt-get install -y grub-common VOLUME /root/env WORKDIR /root/env To build the image we execute the following code in the terminal:
